A week's festival, imagine that, now six plays per week. You know, you wouldn't do it today,
very, very, very difficult today. And I remember coming back now to Orkdale Institute and Blackwood
Institute when they had a week of drama festivals, you know. They'd be queuing for tickets for
hours and hours and hours, queuing, three and four abreast, to get a ticket to go in
for a week's performance six nights. Wonderful, wonderful. You wouldn't see that now. Of course,
I blame television for that.
